frame.name: Inhibit_movement
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> restricts the movement of a <fen>Theme</fen> to within the vicinity of the <fen>Holding_location</fen>, despite the <fen>Theme</fen>'s desire, plan, or tendency towards motion; the <fen>Agent</fen> may also use an <fen>Instrument</fen>. For many of these targets, the means is incorporated. For some LUs, the <fen>Theme</fen> is required to be a sentient entity. Several of these LUs may be used to describe punishment situations when the <fen>Theme</fen> is a sentient entity.
<ex><fex name="Agent">They</fex> <t>held</t> <fex name="Theme">the package</fex> <fex name="Duration">for two months</fex> <fex name="Holding_location">in the border-patrol locker room</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity which is confined.
<ex>He <t>confined</t> <fex name="Thm">340 mutineers</fex> in Burford Church for the next three days under general sentence of death.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Holding_location
FE.definition:
<def-root>The area within which the <fen>Theme</fen> comes to be confined.
<ex>He <t>confined</t> 340 mutineers <fex name="Holding_location">in Burford Church</fex> for the next three days under general sentence of death.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Agent is the person performing the intentional act.
<ex><fex name="Agt">He</fex> <t>confined</t> 340 mutineers in Burford Church for the next three days under general sentence of death.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>The instrument with which the confinement is carried out. </def-root>

FE.name: Motivation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The reason for the confinement.
<ex>He was <t>locked</t> in his room <fex name="Motive">for disobeying his mother</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs. </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The purpose the confinement.
<ex>John was <t>locked</t> in his room <fex name="Purpose">so he could think about what he had done wrong</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that accomplishes the action indicated by the target. <ex>The Lilliputians <t>tied</t> him down <fex name="Mns">by catching him unconscious and traversing his body with their thickest ropes</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Agent</fen> that affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

FE.name: Reason
FE.definition: <def-root>A state of affairs that the <fen>Agent</fen> is responding to in performing the action. </def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Duration</fen> of time for which the <fen>Agent</fen> maintains the confinement of the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-sentient entity which is responsible for restricting the movement or location of the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: confine.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: keep or restrict someone or something within certain limits of (space, scope, or time).

lexUnit.name: lock.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: enclose someone or something by locking a door

lexUnit.name: tie.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: confine by making a knot in or around the opening of a container.

lexUnit.name: shut up.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: confine or exclude by closing something such as a door.

lexUnit.name: restrict.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: deprive of freedom of movement or action.

lexUnit.name: imprison.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: put or keep in prison.

lexUnit.name: confinement.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the action of forcing or keeping withing a contained area.

lexUnit.name: hold.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: keep in a specified position.
